alert.note: Alert for Louisa (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 01 at 8:36PM CST until March 08 at 2:00AM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Quad Cities IA IL has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Iowa... Iowa River at Wapello affecting Louisa County. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE MONDAY NIGHT TO EARLY WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Iowa River at Wapello. * WHEN...From late Monday night to early Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Agricultural land near the river is flooded and water covers most islands. Water starts rising onto secondary roads in Wapello Bottoms. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 17.6 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued late tonight.
